main event: A bright light was observed over Fargo, North Dakota, on February 25, 1967, by multiple witnesses including L.A. Anderson and two juvenile boys who took photographs of the object.
interesting points: The object was described as round, bright white, and about 40 to 50 feet off the ground while hovering., The object was seen by the boys as reddish-orange in color and moved in a zigzag motion before disappearing., Lt. Anderson's report indicated no radar contact in the area during the time of the sighting., The boys took two photographs of the object, but their quality was classified as poor due to the lighting conditions., The objectâ€™s speed and brightness led observers to believe it was not any kind of known aircraft or celestial body.
witness description: Included a police officer and two boys, aged 16 and 18, who reported seeing and photographing the object.
